text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
author: Seneca

text: Every day is a journey, and the journey itself is home.
author: Matsuo Bash≈ç

text: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Let yourself be silently drawn by the strange pull of what you really love. It will not lead you astray.
author: Rumi

text: Smile, breathe, and go slowly.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
author: Alan Watts

text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Buddha

text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
author: Epictetus

text: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
author: Lao Tzu

text: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
author: Dalai Lama

text: It doesn't matter how slow you go, as long as you don't stop.
author: Confucius

text: Those who are possessed by nothing possess everything.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

text: The foolish reject what they see, not what they think; the wise reject what they think, not what they see.
author: Huang Po

text: Only the hand that erases can write the true thing.
author: Meister Eckhart

text: Our view of the world is truly shaped by what we decide to hear.
author: William James

text: Simplicity is a difficult thing to achieve.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: The journey, not the destination matters.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: Correct what you can. Learn from what you can't.
author: Toni Morrison
